content.description: Vagabonds is located on the left side of the lower section of the Black Corridor. Close to the boulders that separate the two tiers, on the left side, there is a trad route, BCR 5L. Its most prominent feature is a large crack up high. Vagabonds is the next route to the right from the crack. The 5.10a rating can be mitigated a bit by wandering a little and seeking an easier path. Lower off with one rope.

This is a new route in the corridor- the third on your left as you enter the lower tier, it ascends an obvious line of features.  

Care should be taken on this route as many of the features are hollow and the route is still shedding rock. The bolts are also spaced somewhat, so be mindful.
Still unnamed brand new route and still needs some cleaning(difficult to do in crowded corridor), so belayer beware of bits of falling sandstone.
content.location: Second route on the left as you enter the corridor.

content.description: This climb starts right of Crude Boys and climbs the rock past two or three bolts (crux) to a horizontal.Â

A trad line in the Black Corridor? Yup. This route is on the left side of the lower section about 20 feet left of the boulders in the middle of the corridor. Start by clipping a bolt and head for the thin crack to the top. Build an anchor with gear and walk off right.

Really kind of a bomb because of its contrived nature, not because of the rock.  Beginning right of Vagabonds (but left of the boulders that separate the corridor) this route starts up a short steep section involving a move from a digit hold to a shelf above.  Can be easily cheated by just reaching right for a ramp and climbing via that.  Two bolts protect the crux, with 5 more to the anchors.
The climb just right of Bonaire/Bon Ez.  I seem to recall it being pretty contrived, with the crux down low on steep, thin rock.
content.protection: A few bolts to a lower-off.

content.description: This climb is more slabby in nature than the other routes in the corridor. No one move is a crux, but several of the moves require balance.
content.protection: Several bolts to a shiny new chain anchor.
content.location: This is now the first route on the left as you enter the corridor. This line was bolted after Roxanna's new guide was published, so it is not included in her topo.

content.description: Bonaire is the fourth route on the left (lower level) route encountered in the Black Corridor.  Climb through 6 or 7 bolts to a fixed anchor at the top.
content.protection: Quickdraws, fixed anchors at the top.

content.description: Bon Ez is the second route on the left (lower level) encountered in the Black Corridor.  Climb through 7 or 8 bolts to a fixed anchor at the top.
content.protection: Quickdraws, fixed anchors at the top.

content.description:
This is the lower level of the Black Corridor, separated from the upper level by a pile of boulders and an easy scramble.  

  These routes are on the left side as viewed from the entrance to the corridor looking towards upper level.
